name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa
input: Gram-negative rods observed. Catalase positive; oxidase also positive. Colonies show classic metallic sheen; green pigmentation; slightly raised; fruity odour. No haemolysis on blood agar; haemolysis type none. Indole negative. Grows well at 20//42. Media used: Blood Agar; Nutrient Agar; MacConkey Agar. Motile with polar flagella. Capsule production variable. No spores. Aerobic profile typical. MR/VP both negative. Citrate utilisation positive. Urease negative. H2S negative. Lactose fermentation negative; glucose fermentation negative; sucrose fermentation negative. Nitrate reduction positive. LDC, ODC and ADH all negative. Gelatin hydrolysis positive. Esculin hydrolysis negative. DNase negative. ONPG negative. NaCl tolerance (>=6%) variable. Lipase test positive. Xylose, rhamnose, mannitol, sorbitol all negative. Maltose negative. Arabinose negative. Raffinose negative. Inositol negative. Trehalose negative. Coagulase negative.

expected.Colony Morphology: Metallic Sheen; Green Pigmentation; Slightly Raised; Fruity Odour
expected.Media Grown On: Blood Agar; Nutrient Agar; MacConkey Agar

name: Staphylococcus aureus
input: Gram-positive cocci in clusters. Catalase positive; oxidase negative. Colonies: golden; smooth; round; buttery texture. Haemolysis positive with clear beta pattern. Indole negative. Temperature range about 20//40. Plated on Blood Agar; Nutrient Agar; Mannitol Salt Agar. Non-motile. Capsule variable. No spores. Facultative anaerobe. MR negative, VP positive. Citrate negative. Urease positive. H2S negative. Lactose fermentation variable; glucose fermentation strongly positive; sucrose fermentation positive. Nitrate reduction positive. LDC, ODC, ADH all negative. Gelatin hydrolysis positive. Esculin hydrolysis negative. DNase positive. ONPG negative. No growth with >=6% NaCl beyond MSA selectivity (variable as usual). Lipase positive. Xylose negative; rhamnose negative; mannitol positive; sorbitol variable. Maltose positive. Arabinose negative. Raffinose variable. Inositol negative. Trehalose positive. Coagulase positive.

name: Haemophilus influenzae
input: Gram-negative, pleomorphic coccobacilli. Catalase positive. Oxidase positive. Colonies are small, moist, and non-haemolytic, exhibiting a smooth texture with a characteristic greyish coloration. No haemolysis is observed, and the haemolysis type is classified as none. Indole production is negative. The bacterium demonstrates growth across a temperature range of 20 to 37°C, with optimal growth conditions at 37°C. Cultivation was successful on Chocolate Agar, Blood Agar, and MacConkey Agar. Motility is absent, which is consistent with the genus. Capsule presence is negative. Spore formation is also negative. Haemophilus influenzae requires a supplemental factor, specifically factor V (nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide), which can be observed in its growth patterns. Facultative anaerobe, capable of anaerobic and aerobic growth. Methyl Red test yields a negative result, whereas the Voges-Proskauer test is also negative. No haemolysis was observed; haemolysis type none. Indole test was negative. Growth was observed within a temperature range of 45 to 65°C. The organism was non-motile, with motility type negative. Capsule was not detected; spore formation was observed. Growth was strictly aerobic. Methyl Red and Voges–Proskauer tests were negative. Citrate and urease tests were negative. No hydrogen sulfide production was detected. Lactose and sucrose were not fermented; glucose fermentation was positive. Nitrate reduction was negative. Lysine, ornithine, and arginine decarboxylation reactions were negative. Gelatin hydrolysis was positive; esculin hydrolysis was negative. DNase and ONPG tests were negative. No growth was observed in media containing ≥6% NaCl. Lipase activity was not detected. Xylose, rhamnose, mannitol, sorbitol, maltose, arabinose, raffinose, and inositol were not fermented. Trehalose fermentation was positive. Coagulase test was negative. TSI agar demonstrated a K/K reaction with no gas production.

expected.Media Grown On: Nutrient Agar

name: Enterococcus faecalis
input: Microscopic examination demonstrated Gram-positive cocci. Catalase and oxidase tests were negative. Following incubation on blood agar and bile esculin agar, colonies were observed to be grey, smooth, and circular, exhibiting a smooth colony pattern. No pigment was detected. A fermented odor was noted. No haemolysis was observed; haemolysis type none. Indole test was negative. Growth was observed between 10 and 45°C. The organism was non-motile, with motility type negative. Capsule and spore formation were not observed. Growth was consistent with a facultative anaerobe. Methyl Red test was positive; Voges–Proskauer test was negative. Citrate and urease tests were negative. No hydrogen sulfide production was detected. Lactose, glucose, and sucrose were fermented. Nitrate reduction was negative. Lysine and ornithine decarboxylase tests were negative; arginine dihydrolase was positive. Gelatin hydrolysis was negative. Esculin hydrolysis was positive. DNase test was negative. ONPG test was positive. Growth was observed in media containing ≥6% NaCl. Lipase activity was not detected. Xylose and rhamnose were not fermented. Mannitol, sorbitol, maltose, and trehalose were fermented. Arabinose, raffinose, and inositol were not fermented. Coagulase test was negative. TSI agar demonstrated an A/A reaction with no gas production.
